radiographic_examinations.findings: Bilateral nasal polypoid lesions consistent with inflammatory polyps, mucosal thickening in all paranasal sinuses, and expansion of a left anterior ethmoid air cell indicating a mucocele. The left aspect of the bony sella was elevated, with superior displacement of the normal-appearing pituitary gland, which abutted the optic chiasm. No signal abnormality was noted in the optic nerves on T2-weighted images, and there was no enhancement along the course of the optic nerves.

Extensive radiodense material in the paranasal sinuses, the ethmoid air cells, and the sphenoid sinuses, with expansion of ethmoid air cells and the sphenoid sinuses. Erosion of both optic canals, the floor of the sphenoid sinus, and the sella turcica. There was mass effect on the pituitary gland, which was displaced superiorly and to the right by the expanded left sphenoid sinus.
